snippet: NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital had allowed television crews to film two patients without their consent: one who was dying, the other in significant distress.
abstract: Health and Human Services's Office for Civil Rights says NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital has agreed to pay $2.2 million federal fine for letting television crews film two patients without consent, even after being asked to stop; regulator also makes clear privacy rules governing filming of patients, which could put end to reality television shows that capture medical emergencies in progress.
lead_paragraph: NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital had allowed television crews to film two patients without their consent: one who was dying, the other in significant distress.

headline.main: New York Hospital to Pay $2.2 Million Over Unauthorized Filming of 2 Patients
headline.print_headline: Hospital to Pay $2.2 Million Over Filming of 2 Patients Without Their Consent
